Alberton School is proactively looking at physically returning to school for the Fall 2020-21 school year. The administration and board are looking at various options for our students' return. At this time our elementary students will be attending school Monday through Thursday and JH/HS students will be on a hybrid schedule alternating days with virtual learning on days not present.

As a community we need to be flexible and be able to rotate from plan to plan fluently as situations change. We do not want to lose students and will find a way to serve every student in the district, to meet the needs of families, and the educational needs of each student.

We will continue to follow the directives of the County Health Department and Governor's directives.

The final reopening plan will be confirmed at the regular School Board Meeting, on Tuesday, August 11, 2020, 7 PM.

Steve Picard
Superintendent
